body:
Bisected to 4b32e7cc33f2972417436fbc86d915944f6c906a Enhancements to unraisable plugin (#12958). The major chunk of the extra time is `gc_collect_harder` but not all of it.

cc @graingert

@graingert any chance you can take a look at this? The CI times are really high, with some jobs taking 30+ minutes...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f8a3905d-2149-4a94-9133-deefc4f10b03)

issue.title: pytester: patch GC_COLLECT_ITERATIONS to speed up the test suite

labels.name: skip news
labels.description: used on prs to opt out of the changelog requirement

labels.name: backport 8.4.x
labels.description: apply to PRs at any point; backports the changes to the 8.4.x branch

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Because `pytester.runpytest()` executes the full session cycle (including `pytest_unconfigure`), it was calling `gc.collect()` in a loop multiple timesâ€”even for small, fast tests. This significantly increased the total test suite runtime.

To optimize performance, pytester now patches `GC_COLLECT_ITERATIONS` to skip `gc.collect()` entirely, matching the behavior before #12958.

Locally the test suite runtime improved dramatically, dropping from 425s to 160s.

Fixes #13482.

issue.title: pytester: avoid unraisableexception gc collects in inline runs to speed up test suite

issue.body:
This is an alternative to #13513. I had to change some tests to run in a subprocess and tweak them a bit to make it work.

Fixes #13482.

Closes #13513.
